meanings.definition: Edit (a piece of writing) excessively or unnecessarily.
meanings.sent1: She kept overediting her essay, changing every word multiple times.
meanings.sent2: I tend to overedit my emails before sending them out.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that she must have overedited her lesson plan because it was full of unnecessary details.
meanings.sent4: His constant overediting of the document turned it into a jumbled mess.
meanings.sent5: The writer's habit of overediting made the story lose its original charm.

meanings.definition: The act of making too many changes to a piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: Overediting can sometimes lead to confusion for the reader.
meanings.sent2: I realized my manuscript needed a lot of overediting before it could be published.
meanings.sent3: The overediting of the script turned the play into a comedy instead of a drama.
meanings.sent4: The overediting of the article stripped away its authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The overediting process took longer than the initial writing of the book.
